name: j-man
text: man i didn't know you can do that in a grocery store

name: ceres
text:
I know several people that do this. Some pay for it, but three of them will steal it. Every damned time they're out shopping. They're pretty well off too. Not precisely as rich as Ray, but definitely mansion, pool, nice cars and all that.
I wonder if they're wealthy in spite of or because of that attitude.

name: zeal
text: When I was a lad I went with my mom to the grocery store on a really hot summer's day, and we just took some Butterfinger ice cream bars out of the box since we were buying the whole thing anyway and ate them in the store.

name: ghede
text: Ditto, but with cans of soda.

name: meowmix
text: Man, how do you think rich people stay rich? By not spending any of their money, that's how.

name: tekende
text: I have a bad habit of getting popcorn chicken from the Wal-Mart deli, eating it as I shop, and then when I'm finished with it, just leaving it somewhere in the store, not paying for it.

name: rowboat
text: Keep doing that and you might accidentally put them out of business. Everybody would be mad at you.

name: dorothypoopbot
text: A comment left by dorothypoopbot was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ted0phile, twohundredninety, TonyHighwind, jimijazz2, katethegreat, mystkmanat, rachel, toyoda, Appers)

name: afrothunder
text: Because Wal-Mart is apparently beloved by everyone else in the world! Who would hate a store that sells 5 pounds of chocolate chip wrapped breakfast sausages for $14.99?

name: dusty
text: I start fires!

name: sp1derbaby
text: ...in the store, using their briquettes and matches, all not paying for them, all preemptively emptying the fire extinguishers into the candy floss machine...

name: liamc
text: This is a fun comment, nicely matched with the avatar in mood. I am pro-this.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: You are Kramer.

name: slow_learner
text: bad like how?

name: tekende
text: Immoral? Regardless of one's opinion of Walmart, it's still stealing.

name: dusty
text: But, regardless of one's opinion of stealing, it's still Walmart.

name: ajesteronly
text:
I steal shit repeatedly from Wal-mart. Mostly food. I live in Bumfuck, Eastern Kentucky, so there are no good grocery stores, so I muft shop there.

I mostly steal cheeses, sauces and seasonings, such as curries and whatnot. Whatever fits in my large coat pockets.

I refuse to pay those bastards for shit that they're overpricing anyway.

name: tekende
text: "Overpricing"? I'm not going to get into an argument about the relative merits of Wal-mart, but overpricing is not a particular sin of theirs.

name: afterward
text: Too true--unless by "overpricing" ajesteronly refers to the high spiritual, emotional, and psychological costs of shopping at Wal-mart.

name: gamemeister27
text: I sometimes eat things I'm buying later in the store. I don't know why you wouldn't as long as you paid for it. Stealing it is a hella dick move though.

name: jaypage
text: as someone who worked at a wal-mart: it is frowned upon. They call it grazing. I stocked groceries overnight, and there is no way to communicate the amount of half-eaten food I pulled out off the back of shelves. nasty shit.

name: tripe
text: I am pretty sure that stealing from a store is usually frowned upon by the store.

name: robocop
text: have you not seen rumble in the bronx?

name: wolfsleepy
text: That's precisely how I would react if someone suddenly poured beer down my gullet. Yaaay!

name: i_love_kate
text: Mine would be a "wow" of appreciative astonishment. Provided he didn't spill any on me.

name: isaach
text: someone poured beer down my gullet once.  it was among the best moments of my young life

name: soticoto
text:
Someone poured beer down my gullet once. I nearly drowned on it as I was half-asleep at the time...

... And beer is the only alcoholic beverage I don't like anyway. They could have at least tried it with Sambuca or something.

name: chloraloner
text: At least the liquid went into your throat. I have no sense of smell any more for the Bombay Sapphire. My Roommate's arms were shattered that night.

name: deimosrising
text: I do this in the store all the time. I once finished an entire bag of trail mix while shopping, tossed the bag behind some soup cans, and told them to ring up some trail mix on my bill because I had eaten a bag. I spent the whole ride home wondering why I mentioned it.

name: rapid_roy
text:
I see you are a man of honour.
When I was a kid I'd eat cookies in the store.

name: mortshire
text: Oh yeah, Nilla Wafers.  So tasty.

name: tekende
text: Ooh, those are good. Nilla Wafers, and milk...damnit, I'm gonna have to go get some after work.

name: hyetal
text:
When I was younger my mom brought me to the grocery store to get some ice cream. I walked into the store, lost in daydreams, grabbed the ice cream, and walked back to the car. Mom said, "That was fast! What'd you do%u2014steal it?"

My face blanched as I realized I had stolen it, and I ran back into the store, trying to carry it as subtly as I could, and threaded my way around the aisles so that when I approached the checkout it looked as if I had come from the ice cream area and not the front door, and then paid for the ice cream.

In retrospect I should've just said, "Oh, yes. Yes, I guess I did. Oh well."

name: hyetal
text: Damn you, BBcode.  %u2014 is supposed to be an em dash.

name: semiquaver
text: Dude.  BBcode doesn't even display the plus sign.  Why would you think that an em dash would work?

name: tekende
text:
I did something similar once when I was about...oh, ten, maybe. I was at the mall with my mom and her friends and I went into B. Dalton Booksellers (remember when they were a thing?). While there, I found a book I wanted ( Bruce Coville's Book of Nightmares ) and decided to see if my mom would lend me the money to buy it, so I carried it out of the store to go show it to her.

My mom said, "They let you take that out of the store?" and I experienced a sinking feeling in my gut as I realized I had basically stolen the book. I surreptitiously carried it back into the store.

I do not remember whether my mom bought it for me or not.

name: i_love_kate
text: It had a shitty story about a gnome in a magic trick box, if that helps.

name: tekende
text: Actually, I do remember now that she bought it for me. I don't remember that particular story though.

name: redion
text: that story sounds vaguely familiar. i read me some bruce coville back in the day. oh man the living bus that ate children. (i think it's from another book though)

name: redion
text: that story sounds vaguely familiar. i read me some bruce coville back in the day. oh man the living bus that ate children. (i think it's from another book though)

name: wittyname
text:
I once walked out of a Laura Secord or some ice cream shop that is much to expensive. After a while, I realized that the woman at the cash didn't give my change, and I was positive I gave her like a twenty. So I started going back after leaving like ten minutes earlier, getrting all huffed and thinking "Bitch trying to steal my money."

I got back and she yelled at me for walking out without paying for my ice cream. I payed and walked away, in shame.

name: anzio
text: Yeah, pretty much if you frequent a super market and pay for the food every time, I bet you could eat whatever the fuck you wanted whilst browsing.

name: untilyouaresonude
text: Oh, to be a corn salesman on a day like today!

name: spinynorman
text: Oh, to be a corn salesman period. They are kings of men.

name: orvel
text: A comment left by orvel was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by goatmasterflash, Mangtastic, Gompo, d3athcann0n, lux)

name: boredom_man
text: No. But what is your avatar? It's interesting.

name: sp1derbaby
text: You are right exclamation mark!

name: orvel
text: Even if I were right, there'd be no way to criticize spinynorman without getting lamed to hell ellipsis...

name: i_love_kate
text: I'd have thrown a comma in there, comma, too, period.

name: heccibiggs
text: Excuse me. You're British. FULL STOP.

name: dickie_roxx
text:
I love you period
Do you love me question mark
Please please exclamation point
I wanna hold you in parenthesis

Come on, I know a good percentage of acheworld was like *born* in 1992, but I can't be the only one who saw this exchange and immediately grew this worm in the ear.

name: petitegitan
text: What cookies taste good with beer?!

name: deimosrising
text: What kind of beer?

name: centipede_damascus
text: Beer such as a respectable man would drink while perusing the aisles of his local five-and-dime. I don't know.

name: straw
text: Those circuis cookies with frosting and sprinkles.  It's because they taste kind of like wedding cake and beer and wedding cake is an awesome combination.  I know this.  Ray knows this.

name: jrpigman
text:
This is correct. The only problem with said circus cookies is the lard-based frosting forming a thin skin of crisco on one's tongue. Beer is the only known way to cut said coating.

The situation is win-win .

name: bourbonsamurai
text: What cookies taste bad with beer?

name: orvel
text: [IMGS OFF]

name: orvel
text: [IMGS OFF]

name: tekende
text: This is not based on experience, but I have a hunch that ginger snaps might taste good with beer.

name: sp1derbaby
text: Damn! Now I want me some brandy snaps and Irish coffee.

name: leon_sumbitches
text: I wish someone would do that to me while I was at work!

name: relaxing
text: I wish my state would allow alcohol sales in grocery stores!

name: gompo
text: The hell?  What state doesnt let normal beer be sold at a grocery?

name: relaxing
text: PA and NJ for two.

name: straw
text:
O man, PA is such a hassle to get beer if you've never tried to get beer there before.

Also you're not allowed to sell beer as well as wine or liquor and if you sell wine or liquor you're not allowed to sell food.

name: straw
text: In New York, I meant  X(

name: quantumcasaba
text:
At first I thought you said PA is such an asshole.

You would not have been wrong. My cup often runneth out.

name: zem
text: what the heck

name: relaxing
text: do you see now, what we go through?

name: bixschmix
text:
In PA you can only buy 6packs from bars, and have to go to a "beer distributor" to buy anything bigger-- cases, kegs, etc. Plus, if you want booze or wine you have to go to a state-run liquor store, which closes at 8 or 9 and isn't open at all on Sunday!

(Can you tell I'm a little bitter?)

name: tekende
text: STATE-RUN?! What the holy fucking HELL.

name: bixschmix
text: Yeah, and don't even TRY using a fake ID in one of those bad boys. They run the numbers. (However, as a plus, stuff is fairly cheap because of the power PA has to negotiate deals statewide. Doesn't make up for the closed-at-night-and-on-weekends, though.)

name: heccibiggs
text: What the HELL. The man is trying to bring you down, and apparently succeeding. Also, excuse my non-American-ness, but what state is PA?

name: rowboat
text: Delaware.

name: bixschmix
text: And by Delaware, my dear rowboat means Pennsylvania.

name: rowboat
text: Shhhh!

name: bixschmix
text:
What, did we start a game of Confuse-The-Brit here and nobody told me?

You've got to keep me filled in, Rowboat.

name: heccibiggs
text: You bastards.

name: mattylite
text:
I love that game
It is extremely awesome

name: laserblade
text: Ha ha ha.  "Oi!"  Ha ha.

name: invidious
text: Delaware is just a suburb of Philadelphia, after all.

name: rowboat
text: What isn't?

name: sharktastic
text:
Nah, the state stores here are more expensive because it's a monopoly. Boone's Farm wine in PA cost me over $4.00, the same bottle in Illinois cost almost a dollar less.
Yes, yes, I know - $4.00 wine - sometimes you just have to splurge a little on yourself and go for the Boone's Farm, instead of the usual $3.50 Thunderbird. I'm such a wine snob.

name: riazm
text:
In Sweden, almost all alcohol shops are state run, and by state, I mean Sweden:

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Systembolaget

NOW YOU KNOW.

name: atticusonline
text: Systembolager sounds like a pretty sweet beer.

name: greenkoolayd
text: william penn was a puritan.  all these hundreds of years later and not many things have changed...

name: dickie_roxx
text: Pardon, friend, but Penn was a Friend.  In those days, maybe not so easily distinguished from Puritan in terms of dress, social mores, etc, so your mistake is understandable.  Especially if your only idea of Quakerism comes from oats.

name: greenkoolayd
text: i was being unspecific becasue of the similarities you mentioned, but i do appreciate your clarification.  thou art upstanding and scholarly.

name: dickie_roxx
text: And thou art gracious in clarification.  Thy point stands. /quaker grammar

name: nickb285
text: Wow, that sounds a lot like Utah, except that we can't buy kegs at all. Plus we can only get beer that's 3.2% ABW (4% ABV) in the grocery stores, real beer is purchased from the liquor stores at disgusting markups--a 12 oz. bottle of Newcastle is $2.15, for example. At least we can get 30-packs of our shitty watered-down beer.

name: love_is_so_punk
text: Not to mention that our state-run liquor stores are also closed on Sunday.  At least if you live in one of the more populated areas you can buy liquor until 10 pm Mon-Sat, but out here in the sticks the liquor stores close at 7 pm.

name: love_is_so_punk
text: P.S. Our state-run liquor stores don't sell it cheap because of their buying power like bixschmix says PA does.  Liquor is more expensive here than anywhere else I've seen it.

name: rowboat
text:
It's funny that the states where one would most need to drink himself to sleep are the ones that make it the most difficult to do so.

It's so funny you could cry. Cry your sober ass to sleep.

name: cdl146
text: Yeah, getting any sort of alcohol in PA is a huge hassel. You can't get beer and hard liquor at the same place, and you have to go to different stores depending on if you're buying a six pack or a case. I wish I was making this up.

name: fuckyoufriday
text: Yeah, speaking as a newcomer to the state of PA, the beer situation is all kinds of fucked up here.

name: le_chien_manquee
text: it's the same in virginia.  you can buy beer in regular stores, but the state - the fucking state! - has a monopoly on liquor sales.  if you think this sounds a bit like soviet fucking russia, you'd be right.  fucking right wing nutjobs telling me where to buy my booze.  cunts

name: plummet
text: IN SOVIET RUSSIA BEER BUYS YOU

name: fielding
text: A comment left by fielding was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Unfun, atticusonline, gbeaton, cailetshadow)

name: fielding
text: A comment left by fielding was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Unfun, Tweakzers, atticusonline, gbeaton, cailetshadow)

name: direhaggis
text: In Prava, there is no Ivestia and in Ivestia, there is no Pravda.

name: atticusonline
text: wow yeah i'm pretty sure he was just making a yakov smirnoff joke...

name: laserblade
text: No love for the haters, man.  This pair of comments was too ridiculous not to chubb.

name: aki
text: T'other way round

name: philosophe
text: My cuz says in CO the groceries carry 3.2% beer. People buy then look at the can and go DAMN IT!

name: setzkin
text: True story, I was on a trip to Denver over the summer, that shit's all over the place

name: proof_man
text: doesn't the elevation compensate for it slightly?

name: rodneystubbs
text:
All you guys make me love TN more than ever.

I just got to thinking about how we can buy the stuff in gas stations. Think about that. It's like a drive-thru bar.

name: simms
text: During the Summer months, I work at a beer distributer in PA. Our store does have an actual drive-thru. I hate it. It's mostly just for assholes that don't want to put out their cigarette or the regular type of assholes and white trash.

name: presterjohn
text: This entire discussion seems like a foreign language to a New Orleanian. Down here the only rule about booze is not to use glass containers when you're drinking in the streets.

name: bixschmix
text:
My cousin worked in a drive-through liquor store. They just hand you a brown bag with a bottle in it and you go on your merry way...

Oh, Kentucky.

name: 1iwikiwi3
text:
Speaking of drive-thru...
Texas has drive-thru BEER stores. LITERALLLY.
A barn you drive into, they help you, you drive out of, called "Beer Barn". GOOOOO Texas! And your ignorance...

name: relaxing
text: This is more common than you think. In some states, you can buy actual cups of beer, from your car, provided they have a lid.

name: tekende
text: Wha-a-a-a-a-t

name: scifigrl47
text: Same in MA.  Once they abolished the blue laws, it was pretty much, "Aw, to hell with it, you're just going to go to New Hampshire for it anyway..."

name: stuart
text:
It's pretty cool to grow up in PA and find wine available in 7-Elevens where you move to, though.

Pennsylvania: A Nice Place To Leave

name: quantumcasaba
text:
I often find myself thinking that you have some of the best commentary but until now I refrained from saying so.
This comment is the final nail. Good show, sir.
I visited some friends in Baltimore this weekend and had a moment of pause when I noticed a store with both liquor and beer. Why the hell not, Pennsylvania? Why the hell not?

name: vreeeee
text:
To grow up in Pennsylvania is to be grateful to move somewhere else.

I am currently visiting parents in my ancestral homelands of Western PA and lamenting my sobriety.

name: sharktastic
text: I left PA over 12 years ago for Chicago...and 4 years ago I moved back to the Poconos. The Midwest is just too flat for me I guess. I love the mountains, lakes and forests here. I am not a fan of the liquor laws though - they are bass-ackwards.

name: elvaquero
text: You can't buy liquor in grocery stores in Oregon, but you can get beer and wine

name: nutmeg
text: and DE!

name: saru
text: Jeez, it's not quite as bad as the situation in Pennsylvania, but also in Oregon and Washington, you can only get spirits in state-run liquor stores.

name: stormagnet
text:
Seriously. Plus, all the WA liquor stores close at ridiculous early hours. Stayed late at work? TOO BAD.

Every time I go on a trip, I get shell-shocked all over again by the Booze! Everywhere! I'm in Tokyo right now, and let me tell you- The Stories About The Vending Machines Are True.

name: bixschmix
text:
My (naive female) friend spent a semester in Japan and bought all kinds of shit from those vending machines. But there was one thing that came in one of those plastic eggs that she couldn't figure out. Her boyfriend came to visit, and she asked him if he knew what it did.

"Hon... that's a cock ring."

name: vincentkv
text:
In Minnesota, you can have 3.2 beer in grocery stores and gas stations, but no wine or booze. Also, no liquor sales on sunday PERIOD.

Hudson, WI loves Sundays. LOVES 'em.

name: rowboat
text: I live in St. Louis, a city built on beer. If they tried anything like that here, we'd burn the fucker down. They're aware of this, so they basically shower us with the stuff at ever corner. I stopped in Pennsylvania for a night, once. Took me three hours to score a six-pack. It was like a sick, god-damned scavenger hunt. Unless Dave Blood is resurrected and The Dead Milkmen reunite for one night in Philly, I won't be returning.

name: heccibiggs
text: I am so glad I live in the UK. All types of booze available in supermarkets, off licences (that's "liquor store" to you Yanks) and corner shops. Plus we can get started three years earlier.

name: rowboat
text: I got started when I was damn well ready to get started. That's right - I was a criminal.

name: heccibiggs
text: Well, yeah me too. But it's much less stressful once it's actually legal.

name: rowboat
text: Much less fun, too.

name: heccibiggs
text:
Disagreement box!

It's far more fun drinking in a pub than drinking cider or straight vodka in a park, huddled up in a massive coat and unable to really see anyone, and just waiting for the police to turn up and tip it all away in front of your horror-stricken eyes.

name: rowboat
text:
I dunno - I had some real good times getting drunk out on the railroad tracks in the Springtime. It's like how smoking weed was so much more fun back when I still lived at home. I had to steal away to some golf course in the middle of the night with my friends, all stiflin' giggles and lightin' the bowl up under our shirts so no one could see the flicker.

Wow. You've gone and made me all nostalgic.

name: heccibiggs
text: Hmm maybe. Actually, who am I kidding, me and my best friend will still drink wine in the local park in the summer. Something about it is just great.

name: relaxing
text:
How do we know heccibiggs is actually from Europe?
1) In the United States, cider is not a preferred beverage among underaged drinkers.
2) American juvenile delinquents do not fear the police for emptying out their drinks, they fear the police for knocking their teeth out with a metal club.

name: nickb285
text: U-S-A! U-S-A!

name: killingthejay
text: Or tasing them, thereby potentially emptying their drinks from their bladders into their pants.

name: greenkoolayd
text: in the USA, cider is usually just cloudy apple juice.  shes referring to 'hard' cider.........

name: relaxing
text: Hard cider is not a preferred beverage among underaged drinkers.

name: relaxing
text: I went to the Dave Blood memorial show. That was a moving experience... Rodney telling the audience, "This rock and roll attitude is bullshit, fuck the Who, I hope I get old before I die."

name: rowboat
text: When Rodney Anonymous speaks, you better listen. I know I always have.

name: fineoakstructure
text: Kind of off topic, but Tugena is one of the best rock instrumentals ever.  I'm not sure if this is a widely accepted stance, but I'm taking it anyways.

name: rowboat
text: Personally, I'll go with "KKsuck2." But, yeah - both amazing.

name: relaxing
text: You know what, Stewart? I like you...

name: smilebuddha
text:
You're not like the other people here, in the trailer park ... They're good fine people, Stuart. But they don't know what the queers are doing
to the soil!

name: smilebuddha
text: Well, they had a reunion, a memorial concert at the Trocadero downtown. Quite a number of years ago.  But I was there.  God, the good times!

name: senseihollywood
text: I 5'd this for the last panel...Yaaaaay beer!

name: mastronaut
text: I 5'd it because Ray spins around real quick and gives Beef a look like "The hell you think I can't do that in the grocery store?"

name: sp1derbaby
text: Nonsense!

name: riazm
text: Look how beef puts up his hands in defence of Ray's challenging glare. The cat knows to pick his battles.

name: hendetta
text: The little corn salesman loves to drink the beer.

name: deancain29
text: Ive just noticed Ray's ears. they're not very cat-like. strange? who's with me?

name: connellingus
text: American curls tend to have round ears.

name: carterst
text: "Yum" is actually a pretty decent argument.

name: pitseleh
text: Everyone's expression in the last panel is PRICELESS!

name: solobuttons
text: This is so weird

name: stuart
text: Yeah, this one is a little surreal.

name: 60teeth
text:
Is the little corn salesman shaking his head from side to side in the fifth panel?

Is he doing it because he is so excited that he might get to give away some corn?

name: feetnotes
text: This is how I have always read it, yeah.

name: drskradley
text: I always thought he was puppy-like excited about getting free hooch down his gullet.  That wouldn't make sense in hindsight, really.

name: semiquaver
text: Ash is totally rocking out on your icon and that disturbs me.

name: semiquaver
text: By our icons combined...we are MEN OF SEX

name: the_doz
text: God, they are swaying in time... I feel dizzy...

name: semiquaver
text: He changed his icon.  :(.

name: the_doz
text: Keep on rockin', ear-flickin' Colbert.

name: semiquaver
text: If drskradley is not there to rock along with me, I can but roll.

name: the_doz
text: Aaaaaaannd we're back!

name: semiquaver
text: YES!!!!

name: budenhagen
text: It's all just so absurd.

name: dasilodavi
text: One of the things I like about Onstand's early work is his economy of words.  The strips are hillarious and not wordy.  After numerous storylines and long discussions it's good to see something like this.

name: petewriggley
text: this is in my top 5

name: hendetta
text: Yum, man!

name: nucleargeranium
text: He looks very distraught in the fifth panel, but calms down when a chilly brew is poured down his throat, though I am in fact unsure of the temperature of said beer.

name: xiaomimi
text:
Weekend Blogs

Roast Beef: update for December 10

-Philippe-
The new neighbors are kind of weird!
I am not sure if I like the new neighbors.

Lyle: Flavorful Sandwiches.
Molly: Maybe some sunlight.


Today's Blogs

Ray: Roast Beef, Housemate.
Teodor: Boogie Nights neighbors
Little Nephew: Merchant Marine, y'alls!

name: direhaggis
text: So I get why the guy would be bewildered by Ray holding an open beer. What is Roast Beef doing to warrant attention? Is it that he's wearing shorts?

name: alzuna
text: I think he's just excited people are actually looking in the direction of, and possibly walking towards his griddled corn table.

name: chuvak
text: I haven't been counting but I think that this strip comes up about 1 out of 5 times I press "random strip". It's TOTALLY FREAKING MY SHIT OUT.

name: charchar
text: How does one griddle corn? Is this in the cookbook I am too po' to buy, perhaps? I must know!

name: boredom_man
text: Shuck fresh corn, boil it for two or three minutes, then freeze it. The result will be easy-to-work-with kernels that can be cobbed and fried in butter, or simply wrapped in foil with butter and oven-roasted for a similar taste without all the cobbing.

name: sharpdresseddan
text: YAYYY!!!

name: atticusonline
text:
[IMGS OFF]

this is absolutely awesome

name: odei
text: Yay!

name: mystkmanat
text:
this earned a literal lol.
that poor grocery store employee's joyful outburst has officially made my day.

name: sje46
text: When I was a kid, my sibs and I ate chips before my mom bought them whenever we went to Market Basket.  Never got in trouble.  WE just hand the cashier the empt bag and she'd charge us for it and throw it away.  Also I loved doing cream shots (the supermarket offered free coffee with the little creamers and me and my sister used to take them like shots).

name: arelladawn
text: What the hell is griddled corn?  would that involve like maybe frying kernels in oil or what?

name: dusty
text: I just can't get my wife to get achewood, she hasn't got the other ones I've shown her. I figured this was a good introductory strip, you don't have to know the characters for it to be funny, but it tells you a lot about them. Alas, she said she doesn't get it. "Yaaaay!" whats not to get?

name: fancyrat
text: Well and truly my very favorite strip.

name: carlyle
text: I wonder if you could eat everything before leaving the store, then take the boxes to the cashier, pay, and go back home.

name: rowboat
text:
Only one to find out; eat thirty hits of acid and submerge yourself in Flambeau Lake for four days.

It is the only way.

name: hbananaplus
text: Ray dares Beef to say ONE more word about it.
